item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The FFT Strikes Back: An Efficient Alternative to Self-Attention (160 points | 46 comments)
2. Telescope – an open-source web-based log viewer for logs stored in ClickHouse (99 points | 29 comments)
3. PanGui – A cross-platform UI library with a razor sharp focus on performance (8 points | discuss)
4. Page is under construction: A love letter to the personal website (211 points | 73 comments)
5. I Went to SQL Injection Court (964 points | 368 comments)
6. DeepGEMM: clean and efficient FP8 GEMM kernels with fine-grained scaling (339 points | 60 comments)
7. State of emergency declared after blackout plunges most of Chile into darkness (62 points | 26 comments)
8. A simple way of visualizing Git repository (11 points | 3 comments)
9. Hyperspace (743 points | 386 comments)
10. Material Theme has been pulled from VS Code's marketplace (279 points | 208 comments)
11. Iterated Log Coding (61 points | 19 comments)
12. A compendium of "open-source" licenses (34 points | 12 comments)
13. Marek has graciously offered to maintain the dma-mapping tree (40 points | 23 comments)
14. Ask HN: Ethical VC Funds? (20 points | 5 comments)
15. Part two of Grant Sanderson's video with Terry Tao on the cosmic distance ladder (313 points | 58 comments)
16. Launch HN: Browser Use (YC W25) – open-source web agents (203 points | 80 comments)
17. Terence Tao – Machine-Assisted Proofs [video] (104 points | 21 comments)
18. Understanding Surrogate Pairs: Why Some Windows Filenames Can't Be Read (64 points | 37 comments)
19. The journalists training AI models for Meta and OpenAI (33 points | 16 comments)
20. Ggwave: Tiny Data-over-Sound Library (219 points | 50 comments)
21. Hard problems that reduce to document ranking (278 points | 35 comments)
22. A CLI to quickly launch VSCode/cursor devcontainers (16 points | 2 comments)
23. Bald eagles are thriving again after near extinction (246 points | 161 comments)
24. Why are QR Codes with capital letters smaller than QR codes with lower case? (258 points | 67 comments)
25. The Deep Research problem (227 points | 88 comments)
26. The XB-70 (2019) (183 points | 113 comments)
27. Exposed GitHub repos, now private, can be accessed through Copilot (9 points | 3 comments)
28. Evaluating modular RAG with reasoning models (52 points | 11 comments)
29. Modernist Cuisine: The Art and Science of Cooking (94 points | 72 comments)
30. Voker (YC S24) is hiring an LA-based full stack AI software engineer ( | hide)
